contentrichtext.text: In [[computer security]], a '''Network Intrusion Detection System''' ('''NIDS''') is an [[intrusion detection system]] that attempts to discover unauthorized access to a [[computer network]] by [[Packet analyzer|analyzing traffic]] on the network for signs of [[Black hat hacking|malicious activity]].<ref>Ptacek, Thomas H. & Newsham, Timothy N. (January 1998); [http://www.icir.org/vern/Ptacek-Newsham-Evasion-98.ps "Insertion, Evasion, and Denial of Service: Eluding Network Instrusion Detection"]</ref> ==See also== *[[Application protocol-based intrusion detection system]] (APIDS) *[[Bypass switch]] *[[Honeypot (computing)|Honeypot]] (or Honeynet) *[[Host-based intrusion detection system]] (HIDS) *[[Intrusion prevention system]] (IPS) *[[Protocol-based intrusion detection system]] (PIDS) *[[Snort (software)|Snort]], an open source NIDS ==References== {{refimprove|date=January 2012}} {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://iase.disa.mil U.S. Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA)] Information Assurance Support Environment (IASE) *[http://www.skynet-solutions.net/easyids EasyIDS] - Free customized CentOS install cd containing Snort, Barnyard, BASE, ntop, and more. Most of what's needed for a NIDS. *[https://mosaicsecurity.com/categories/60-network-intrusion-detection-system Comprehensive List of Commercial NIDS], Mosaic Security Research {{DEFAULTSORT:Intrusion detection system}} [[Category:Internet Protocol based network software]] [[Category:Computer network security]] [[Category:Intrusion detection systems]] {{Compu-network-stub}} {{computer-security-stub}}
